embeds.title: Supply Scroll
embeds.description:
Rare Relic / All / Downfall

At the start of your 3rd turn, gain :e_colorless: and draw 2 cards.
*A surprisingly detailed inventory of the mob's various bits and bobbles.*

messages.content: feels pretty mediocre, ngl
the 3rd turn delay is a significant downside
delayed lantern+ bag of prep, but 3rd turn is not that important overall
it's "at the start of the third turn play an <Adrenaline>"

messages.content: lol both commons
yeah current form is not as strong as either lantern or bag of prep, and not really niche for rare
What if it made your first strike or defend each turn draw a card?
hermit moment
doesn't feel like it fits the relic

it draws you free cards, gives you a free energy. Its pretty good. everyone says its worse the bag of prep; butmost of the other rare relics in the game are too. Bag of prep is just overpowered and its not fair to put other relics down for being worse then it
I'm happy to see see this as my rare relic, provides consistent value for any deck.
if the effect has to do with unconditional card draw, its comparable to bag of prep
so if its effect (that has to do with card draw) is worse than bag of prep, its just worse than bag of prep

and considering it draws on turn 3 (worse than t1, so objectively worse than bag of prep) and grants an energy on turn 3 (worse than t1, so objectively worse than lantern), combining two **common** relics, making them worse, and making said relic a rare is just too many downsides

I mean comparing its strength with bag of prep. If the relic was supposed to rival bag of prep it would draw like 4 cards; but it doenst since that would be to much. In the base game only a couple of relics are comparable with bag of preps power. Its fine for this relic to be worse then bag of prep because bag of prep is ludicrously strong.
My point is that its more reasonable to compare this relics power with the other rare relics and when you do so it looks pretty good in comparison.
its dogshit compared to other rare relics tho
it just sucks
as free energy and draw goes, its not good
prep is good, but its also a common
so either this becomes a common/uncommon, or it gets a buff

here's a better way to think of it:
"At the start of turn 3, play an Adrenaline"
which is... not rare-levels of strong
Adrenaline is good, but its Rare because its unconditional and has great setup plays with other cards
Supply Scroll makes you wait 3 turns to play a card with no possible synergies or comboes

id be fine if it was a common or uncommon, but as it is now, its weak for a rare

Stone calendar also sucks ballz lmao

even if the regular effect activated turn 2 it would be instantly better

I like the effect, yes waiting until the third turn means it's pretty slow, but there are plenty of elite and boss fights that go that long, and adrenaline gives you a nice boost. Pairs well with things like anchor, horn cleat, bag of preparation, and lantern that can help you get to the third turn more safely. Having cards that provide frontloaded block can also help buy time for this to trigger.

It could probably stand to be lowered in rarity, this feels more like an uncommon to me, though I know it was recently changed and that this is a bit of a placeholder right now. I probably wouldn't buy it from a shop unless I had the synergies I mentioned to help it out (especially since rare relics are pretty expensive), but I would be pretty happy to see it as a random drop from an elite fight/event.
It was good for igniting ghostflames, triggering stance bonuses, got a lot more valuable in a <it's a feature> deck. I'd say it had the least value on slime boss and hermit

embeds.title: It's a Feature
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :e_automaton: / The Automaton / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
Whenever you draw a **Curse** or **Status** card, gain 1 temporary :p_temp: **Strength** :p_strength: and **Dexterity** :p_dexterity:.

messages.content: Almost all of downfall characters have strength and dex scaling so the value of the scroll was a lot more than what it said on the cards especially considering by the third turn you're usually got your scaling engine setted up
